hint.text: Irreducible factors of an expression cannot be broken down further.Eg: For \(7(x+3)\), the irreducible factors are \(7\) and \((x+3)\). Think of it as prime factorisation of algebraic expressions.

solution.text: The irreducible factors of \(_{j}_(x+_{k}_)x\) are \(_{j}_,(x+_{k}_)\) and \(x\); as these cannot be broken down into further factors.

content.text: What are the corect irreducible factors of the algebraic expression \(_{j}_(x+_{k}_)x\) :
